3:
because of the voice of my enemies,
\q because of the oppression of the wicked;
\q for they bring trouble on me
\q and persecute me in anger.
4:
My heart trembles within me,
\q and the terrors of death have fallen on me.
\q
5:
Fearfulness and trembling have come on me,
\q and horror has overwhelmed me.
6:
I said, "Oh, if only I had wings like a dove!
\q Then would I fly away and be at rest.
\q
8:
I would hurry to a shelter
\q from the stormy wind and tempest."
\q
9:
Devour them, Lord, confuse their language!
\q For I have seen violence and strife in the city.
11:
Wickedness is in the middle of it;
\q oppression and deceit do not leave its streets.
12:
For it was not an enemy who rebuked me,
\q then I could have borne it;
\q neither was it he who hated me who raised himself up against me,
\q then I would have hidden myself from him.
\q
13:
But it was you, a man equal to myself,
\q my companion and my close friend.
\q
14:
We had sweet fellowship together;
\q we walked in the house of God with the throng.
16:
As for me, I will call on God,
\q and Yahweh will save me.
\q
18:
He will safely rescue my life from the battle that was against me,
\q for those who fought against me were many.
19:
God, the one who rules from eternity,
\q will hear them and humiliate them.
 \qs Selah\qs*
\q They never change,
\q and they do not fear God.
21:
His mouth was smooth as butter,
\q but his heart was hostile;
\q his words were softer than oil,
\q yet they were actually drawn swords.
55:
\m
\d For the chief musician; on stringed instruments. A maschil of David.
\q
